auth_token.description: The Equinix Metal API auth key for API operations

client_id.description: API Consumer Key available under My Apps section in developer portal

client_secret.description: API Consumer secret available under My Apps section in developer portal

endpoint.description: The Equinix API base URL to point out desired environment. Defaults to https://api.equinix.com

request_timeout.description: The duration of time, in seconds, that the Equinix Platform API Client should wait before canceling an API request.  Defaults to 30

response_max_page_size.description: The maximum number of records in a single response for REST queries that produce paginated responses

token.description: API token from the developer sandbox

actions.description: One or more pending actions to complete connection provisioning

authorization_key.description: Text field used to authorize connection on the provider side. Value depends on a provider service profile used for connection

device_interface_id.description: Identifier of network interface on a given device, used for a connection. If not specified then first available interface will be selected

device_uuid.description: Unique identifier of the Network Edge virtual device from which the connection would originate

name.description: Connection name. An alpha-numeric 24 characters string which can include only hyphens and underscores

named_tag.description: The type of peering to set up in case when connecting to Azure Express Route. One of PRIVATE, MICROSOFT, MANUAL, PUBLIC (MANUAL and PUBLIC are deprecated and not available for new connections)

notifications.description: A list of email addresses used for sending connection update notifications

port_uuid.description: Unique identifier of the buyer's port from which the connection would originate

profile_uuid.description: Unique identifier of the service provider's service profile

provider_status.description: Connection provisioning status on service provider's side

purchase_order_number.description: Connection's purchase order number to reflect on the invoice

redundancy_group.description: Unique identifier of group containing a primary and secondary connection

redundancy_type.description: Connection redundancy type, applicable for HA connections. Either primary or secondary

redundant_uuid.description: Unique identifier of the redundant connection, applicable for HA connections

seller_metro_code.description: The metro code that denotes the connection's remote side (z-side)

seller_region.description: The region in which the seller port resides

service_token.description: Unique Equinix Fabric key given by a provider that grants you authorization to enable connectivity from a shared multi-tenant port (a-side)

speed.description: Speed/Bandwidth to be allocated to the connection

speed_unit.description: Unit of the speed/bandwidth to be allocated to the connection

status.description: Connection provisioning status on Equinix Fabric side

vendor_token.description: The Equinix Fabric Token the connection was created with. Applicable if the connection was created with a ServiceToken (a-side) or ZSideServiceToken (z-side)

vlan_ctag.description: C-Tag/Inner-Tag of the connection, a numeric character ranging from 2 - 4094

vlan_stag.description: S-Tag/Outer-Tag of the connection, a numeric character ranging from 2 - 4094

zside_port_uuid.description: Unique identifier of the port on the remote side (z-side)

zside_service_token.description: Unique Equinix Fabric key given by a provider that grants you authorization to enable connectivity to a shared multi-tenant port (z-side)

zside_vlan_ctag.description: C-Tag/Inner-Tag of the connection on the remote side (z-side)

zside_vlan_stag.description: S-Tag/Outer-Tag of the connection on the remote side (z-side)

block.description: One or more additional information key-value objects

actions.description: One or more pending actions to complete connection provisioning

authorization_key.description: Text field used to authorize connection on the provider side. Value depends on a provider service profile used for connection

device_interface_id.description: Identifier of network interface on a given device, used for a connection. If not specified then first available interface will be selected

device_uuid.description: Unique identifier of the Network Edge virtual device from which the connection would originate

name.description: Connection name. An alpha-numeric 24 characters string which can include only hyphens and underscores

port_uuid.description: Unique identifier of the buyer's port from which the connection would originate

profile_uuid.description: Unique identifier of the service provider's service profile

provider_status.description: Connection provisioning status on service provider's side

redundancy_group.description: Unique identifier of group containing a primary and secondary connection

redundancy_type.description: Connection redundancy type, applicable for HA connections. Either primary or secondary

redundant_uuid.description: Unique identifier of the redundant connection, applicable for HA connections

seller_metro_code.description: The metro code that denotes the connection's remote side (z-side)

seller_region.description: The region in which the seller port resides

service_token.description: Unique Equinix Fabric key given by a provider that grants you authorization to enable connectivity from a shared multi-tenant port (a-side)

speed.description: Speed/Bandwidth to be allocated to the connection

speed_unit.description: Unit of the speed/bandwidth to be allocated to the connection

status.description: Connection provisioning status on Equinix Fabric side

vendor_token.description: The Equinix Fabric Token the connection was created with. Applicable if the connection was created with a ServiceToken (a-side) or ZSideServiceToken (z-side)

vlan_ctag.description: C-Tag/Inner-Tag of the connection, a numeric character ranging from 2 - 4094

vlan_stag.description: S-Tag/Outer-Tag of the connection, a numeric character ranging from 2 - 4094

zside_port_uuid.description: Unique identifier of the port on the remote side (z-side)

zside_vlan_ctag.description: C-Tag/Inner-Tag of the connection on the remote side (z-side)

zside_vlan_stag.description: S-Tag/Outer-Tag of the connection on the remote side (z-side)

block.description: Definition of secondary connection for redundant, HA connectivity
Resource allows creation and management of Equinix Fabric	layer 2 connections

access_key.description: Access Key used to accept connection on provider side

aws_connection_id.description: Identifier of a hosted Direct Connect connection on AWS side, applicable for accepter resource with connections to AWS only

aws_profile.description: AWS Profile Name for retrieving credentials from shared credentials file

connection_id.description: Identifier of layer 2 connection that will be accepted

secret_key.description: Secret Key used to accept connection on provider side

block.description: Resource is used to accept Equinix Fabric layer 2 connection on provider side

api_integration.description: Specifies the API integration ID that was provided to the customer during onboarding

authkey_label.description: Name of the authentication key label to be used by the Authentication Key service

bandwidth_alert_threshold.description: Specifies the port bandwidth threshold percentage. If the bandwidth limit is met or exceeded, an alert is sent to the seller

bandwidth_threshold_notifications.description: A list of email addresses that will receive notifications about bandwidth thresholds

connection_name_label.description: Custom name used for calling a connections i.e. circuit. Defaults to Connection

ctag_label.description: C-Tag/Inner-Tag label name for the connections

equinix_managed_port_vlan.description: Boolean value that indicates whether the port and VLAN details are managed by Equinix

integration_id.description: Specifies the API integration ID that was provided to the customer during onboarding

name.description: Name of the service profile. An alpha-numeric 50 characters string which can include only hyphens and underscores

oversubscription.description: Oversubscription limit that will cause alerting. Default is 1x

oversubscription_allowed.description: Boolean value that determines if, regardless of the utilization, Equinix Fabric will continue to add connections to your links until we reach the oversubscription limit

private.description: Boolean value that indicates whether or not this is a private profile.

private_user_emails.description: A list of email addresses associated to users that will be allowed to access this service profile. Applicable for private profiles

profile_statuschange_notifications.description: A list of email addresses that will receive notifications about profile status changes

redundancy_required.description: Boolean value that determines if yourconnections will require redundancy

secondary_vlan_from_primary.description: Indicates whether the VLAN ID of the secondary connection is the same as the primary connection

servicekey_autogenerated.description: Boolean value that indicates whether multiple connections can be created with the same authorization key

speed_customization_allowed.description: Boolean value that determines if customer is allowed to enter a custom connection speed

speed_from_api.description: Boolean valuta that determines if connection speed will be derived from an API call

tag_type.description: Specifies additional tagging information required by the seller profile for Dot1Q to QinQ translation

uuid.description: Unique identifier of the service profile

vc_statuschange_notifications.description: A list of email addresses that will receive notifications about connections approvals and rejections

allow_remote_connections.description: Indicates whether or not connections to this profile can be created from remote metro locations

test_profile.description: Indicates whether or not this profile can be used for test connections

block.description: Block of profile features configuration
One or more definitions of ports associated with the profile

speed.description: Speed/bandwidth supported by given service profile

speed_unit.description: Unit of the speed/bandwidth supported by given service profile

block.description: One or more definitions of supported speed/bandwidth configurations

default_route.description: Boolean flag to set the default route policy. False by default

status.description: Status of the session - up or down

facility.description: Facility where the connection will be created

metro.description: Metro where the connection will be created

mode.description: Mode for connections in IBX facilities with the dedicated type - standard or tunnel

organization_id.description: ID of the organization responsible for the connection. Applicable with type "dedicated"

ports.description: List of connection ports - primary (`ports[0]`) and secondary (`ports[1]`)

project_id.description: ID of the project where the connection is scoped to. Required with type "shared"

service_token_type.description: Only used with shared connection. Type of service token to use for the connection, a_side or z_side

service_tokens.description: Only used with shared connection. List of service tokens required to continue the setup process with [equinix_ecx_l2_connection](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/equinix/equinix/latest/docs/resources/equinix_ecx_l2_connection) or from the [Equinix Fabric Portal](https://ecxfabric.equinix.com/dashboard)

token.description: Only used with shared connection. Fabric Token required to continue the setup process with [equinix_ecx_l2_connection](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/equinix/equinix/latest/docs/resources/equinix_ecx_l2_connection) or from the [Equinix Fabric Portal](https://ecxfabric.equinix.com/dashboard)

vlans.description: Only used with shared connection. VLANs to attach. Pass one vlan for Primary/Single connection and two vlans for Redundant connection

access_private_ipv4.description: The ipv4 private IP assigned to the device

access_public_ipv4.description: The ipv4 maintenance IP assigned to the device

access_public_ipv6.description: The ipv6 maintenance IP assigned to the device

always_pxe.description: If true, a device with OS custom_ipxe will

created.description: The timestamp for when the device was created

custom_data.description: A string of the desired Custom Data for the device

deployed_facility.description: The facility where the device is deployed

deployed_hardware_reservation_id.description: ID of hardware reservation where this device was deployed. It is useful when using the next-available hardware reservation

facilities.description: List of facility codes with deployment preferences. Equinix Metal API will go through the list and will deploy your device to first facility with free capacity. List items must be facility codes or any (a wildcard). To find the facility code, visit [Facilities API docs](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/api/facilities/), set your API auth token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response. Conflicts with metro

force_detach_volumes.description: Delete device even if it has volumes attached. Only applies for destroy action

hardware_reservation_id.description: The UUID of the hardware reservation where you want this device deployed, or next-available if you want to pick your next available reservation automatically

hostname.description: The device hostname used in deployments taking advantage of Layer3 DHCP or metadata service configuration.

ipxe_script_url.description: URL pointing to a hosted iPXE script. More

metro.description: Metro area for the new device. Conflicts with facilities

network.description: The device's private and public IP (v4 and v6) network details. When a device is run without any special network configuration, it will have 3 addresses: public ipv4, private ipv4 and ipv6

network_type.description: Network type of a device, used in [Layer 2 networking](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/layer2/). Will be one of layer3, hybrid, hybrid-bonded, layer2-individual, layer2-bonded

operating_system.description: The operating system slug. To find the slug, or visit [Operating Systems API docs](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/api/operatingsystems), set your API auth token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response

plan.description: The device plan slug. To find the plan slug, visit [Device plans API docs](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/api/plans), set your auth token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response

project_id.description: The ID of the project in which to create the device

project_ssh_key_ids.description: Array of IDs of the project SSH keys which should be added to the device. If you omit this, SSH keys of all the members of the parent project will be added to the device. If you specify this array, only the listed project SSH keys (and any user_ssh_key_ids) will be added. Project SSH keys can be created with the [equinix_metal_project_ssh_key](equinix_metal_project_ssh_key.md) resource

root_password.description: Root password to the server (disabled after 24 hours)

ssh_key_ids.description: List of IDs of SSH keys deployed in the device, can be both user and project SSH keys

storage.description: JSON for custom partitioning. Only usable on reserved hardware. More information in in the [Custom Partitioning and RAID](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/servers/custom-partitioning-raid/) doc

termination_time.description: Timestamp for device termination. For example "2021-09-03T16:32:00+03:00". If you don't supply timezone info, timestamp is assumed to be in UTC.

updated.description: The timestamp for the last time the device was updated

user_data.description: A string of the desired User Data for the device

user_ssh_key_ids.description: Array of IDs of the user SSH keys which should be added to the device. If you omit this, SSH keys of all the members of the parent project will be added to the device. If you specify this array, only the listed user SSH keys (and any project_ssh_key_ids) will be added. User SSH keys can be created with the [equinix_metal_ssh_key](equinix_metal_ssh_key.md) resource

wait_for_reservation_deprovision.description: Only used for devices in reserved hardware. If set, the deletion of this device will block until the hardware reservation is marked provisionable (about 4 minutes in August 2019)

cidr.description: CIDR suffix for IP block assigned to this device

reservation_ids.description: IDs of reservations to pick the blocks from

block.description: A list of IP address types for the device (structure is documented below)

deprovision_fast.description: Whether the OS disk should be filled with `00h` bytes before reinstall

enabled.description: Whether the device should be reinstalled instead of destroyed

preserve_data.description: Whether the non-OS disks should be kept or wiped during reinstall

device_id.description: The ID of the device on which the network type should be set

type.description: Network type to set. Must be one of layer3, hybrid, hybrid-bonded, layer2-individual, layer2-bonded

ip_reservation_id.description: UUID of the Public or VRF IP Reservation to associate, must be in the same metro as the VLAN

private_ipv4_subnet_size.description: Size of the private IPv4 subnet to create for this gateway, one of [8 16 32 64 128]

project_id.description: UUID of the Project where the Gateway is scoped to

vlan_id.description: UUID of the VLAN to associate

vrf_id.description: UUID of the VRF associated with the IP Reservation

cidr.description: Length of CIDR prefix of the block as integer

global.description: Flag indicating whether IP block is global, i.e. assignable in any location

network.description: Network IP address portion of the block specification

public.description: Flag indicating whether IP block is addressable from the Internet

country.description: Two letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2), e.g. US

block.description: Address information block

created.description: When the invitation was created (only known in the invitation stage)

invited_by.description: The user id of the user that sent the invitation (only known in the invitation stage)

invitee.description: The email address of the user to invite

message.description: A message to the invitee (only used during the invitation stage)

nonce.description: The nonce for the invitation (only known in the invitation stage)

organization_id.description: The organization to invite the user to

projects_ids.description: Project IDs the member has access to within the organization. If the member is an 'owner', the projects list should be empty.

state.description: The state of the membership ('invited' when an invitation is open, 'active' when the user is an organization member)

updated.description: When the invitation was updated (only known in the invitation stage)

bonded.description: Flag indicating whether the port should be bonded

disbond_supported.description: Flag indicating whether the port can be removed from a bond

layer2.description: Flag indicating whether the port is in layer2 (or layer3) mode

name.description: Name of the port to look up, e.g. bond0, eth1

native_vlan_id.description: UUID of native VLAN of the port

network_type.description: One of layer2-bonded, layer2-individual, layer3, hybrid and hybrid-bonded. This attribute is only set on bond ports.

port_id.description: UUID of the port to lookup

reset_on_delete.description: Behavioral setting to reset the port to default settings. For a bond port it means layer3 without vlans attached, eth ports will be bonded without native vlan and vlans attached

vlan_ids.description: UUIDs VLANs to attach. To avoid jitter, use the UUID and not the VXLAN

device_id.description: ID of device to be assigned to the VLAN

force_bond.description: Add port back to the bond when this resource is removed. Default is false

native.description: Mark this VLAN a native VLAN on the port. This can be used only if this assignment assigns second or further VLAN to the port. To ensure that this attachment is not first on a port, you can use depends_on pointing to another equinix_metal_port_vlan_attachment, just like in the layer2-individual example above

port_name.description: Name of network port to be assigned to the VLAN

backend_transfer.description: Enable or disable [Backend Transfer](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/backend-transfer/), default is false

created.description: The timestamp for when the project was created

organization_id.description: The UUID of organization under which you want to create the project. If you leave it out, the project will be create under your the default organization of your account

payment_method_id.description: The UUID of payment method for this project. The payment method and the project need to belong to the same organization (passed with organization_id, or default)

updated.description: The timestamp for the last time the project was updated

asn.description: Autonomous System Number for local BGP deployment

deployment_type.description: "local" or "global", the local is likely to be usable immediately, the global will need to be review by Equinix Metal engineers

max_prefix.description: The maximum number of route filters allowed per server

md5.description: Password for BGP session in plaintext (not a checksum)

status.description: Status of BGP configuration in the project

block.description: Optional BGP settings. Refer to [Equinix Metal guide for BGP](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/local-global-bgp/)

description.description: Description string for the API key

project_id.description: UUID of project which the new API key is scoped to

read_only.description: Flag indicating whether the API key shoud be read-only

created.description: The timestamp for when the SSH key was created

fingerprint.description: The fingerprint of the SSH key

name.description: The name of the SSH key for identification

owner_id.description: The UUID of the Equinix Metal API User who owns this key

project_id.description: The ID of parent project

public_key.description: The public key. If this is a file, it

updated.description: The timestamp for the last time the SSH key was updated

cidr.description: the size of the network to reserve from an existing vrf ip_range. `cidr` can only be specified with `vrf_id`. Minimum range is 22-29, with 30-31 supported and necessary for virtual-circuits

custom_data.description: Custom Data is an arbitrary object (submitted in Terraform as serialized JSON) to assign to the IP Reservation. This may be helpful for self-managed IPAM. The object must be valid JSON.

facility.description: Facility where to allocate the public IP address block, makes sense only for type==public_ipv4, must be empty for type==global_ipv4, conflicts with metro

global.description: Flag indicating whether IP block is global, i.e. assignable in any location

metro.description: Metro where to allocate the public IP address block, makes sense only for type==public_ipv4, must be empty for type==global_ipv4, conflicts with facility

network.description: an unreserved network address from an existing vrf ip_range. `network` can only be specified with vrf_id

project_id.description: The metal project ID where to allocate the address block

public.description: Flag indicating whether IP block is addressable from the Internet

quantity.description: The number of allocated /32 addresses, a power of 2

tags.description: Tags attached to the reserved block

type.description: Either global_ipv4, public_ipv4, or vrf. Defaults to public_ipv4.

wait_for_state.description: Wait for the IP reservation block to reach a desired state on resource creation. One of: `pending`, `created`. The `created` state is default and recommended if the addresses are needed within the configuration. An error will be returned if a timeout or the `denied` state is encountered.

devices_max.description: Maximum number devices to be created

devices_min.description: Miniumum number devices to be created

facilities.description: Facility IDs where devices should be created

max_bid_price.description: Maximum price user is willing to pay per hour per device

metro.description: Metro where devices should be created

project_id.description: Project ID

wait_for_devices.description: On resource creation - wait until all desired devices are active, on resource destruction - wait until devices are removed

block.description: Parameters for devices provisioned from this request. You can find the parameter description from the [equinix_metal_device doc](device.md)

created.description: The timestamp for when the SSH key was created

fingerprint.description: The fingerprint of the SSH key

name.description: The name of the SSH key for identification

owner_id.description: The UUID of the Equinix Metal API User who owns this key

public_key.description: The public key. If this is a file, it

updated.description: The timestamp for the last time the SSH key was updated

description.description: Description string for the API key

read_only.description: Flag indicating whether the API key shoud be read-only

user_id.description: UUID of user owning this key

connection_id.description: UUID of Connection where the VC is scoped to

customer_ip.description: The Customer IP address which the CSR switch will peer with. Will default to the other usable IP in the subnet.

description.description: Description of the Virtual Circuit resource

md5.description: The password that can be set for the VRF BGP peer

metal_ip.description: The Metal IP address for the SVI (Switch Virtual Interface) of the VirtualCircuit. Will default to the first usable IP in the subnet.

name.description: Name of the Virtual Circuit resource

nni_vlan.description: Equinix Metal network-to-network VLAN ID (optional when the connection has mode=tunnel)

peer_asn.description: The BGP ASN of the peer. The same ASN may be the used across several VCs, but it cannot be the same as the local_asn of the VRF.

port_id.description: UUID of the Connection Port where the VC is scoped to

project_id.description: UUID of the Project where the VC is scoped to

speed.description: Description of the Virtual Circuit speed. This is for information purposes and is computed when the connection type is shared.

status.description: Status of the virtual circuit resource

subnet.description:
A subnet from one of the IP blocks associated with the VRF that we will help create an IP reservation for. Can only be either a /30 or /31.
				 * For a /31 block, it will only have two IP addresses, which will be used for the metal_ip and customer_ip.
				 * For a /30 block, it will have four IP addresses, but the first and last IP addresses are not usable. We will default to the first usable IP address for the metal_ip.

tags.description: Tags attached to the virtual circuit

vlan_id.description: UUID of the VLAN to associate

vrf_id.description: UUID of the VRF to associate

facility.description: Facility where to create the VLAN

project_id.description: ID of parent project

vxlan.description: VLAN ID, must be unique in metro

ip_ranges.description: All IPv4 and IPv6 Ranges that will be available to BGP Peers. IPv4 addresses must be /8 or smaller with a minimum size of /29. IPv6 must be /56 or smaller with a minimum size of /64. Ranges must not overlap other ranges within the VRF.

local_asn.description: The 4-byte ASN set on the VRF.

name.description: User-supplied name of the VRF, unique to the project

project_id.description: Project ID

description.description: ACL template description, up to 200 characters

device_acl_status.description: Status of ACL template provisioning process on a device, where template was applied

device_details.description: Device Details to which ACL template is assigned to.

device_id.description: Identifier of a network device where template was applied

uuid.description: Unique identifier of ACL template resource

description.description: Inbound rule description, up to 200 characters

dst_port.description: Inbound traffic destination ports. Either up to 10, comma separated ports or port range or any word

source_type.description: Type of traffic source used in a given inbound rule

src_port.description: Inbound traffic source ports. Either up to 10, comma separated ports or port range or any word

subnet.description: Inbound traffic source IP subnet in CIDR format

subnets.description: Inbound traffic source IP subnets in CIDR format

block.description: One or more rules to specify allowed inbound traffic. Rules are ordered, matching traffic rule stops processing subsequent ones.
Resource allows creation and management of Equinix Network Edge device Access Control List templates

authentication_key.description: Shared key used for BGP peer authentication

connection_id.description: Identifier of a connection established between network device and remote service provider that will be used for peering

device_id.description: Unique identifier of a network device that is a local peer in a given BGP peering configuration

local_ip_address.description: IP address in CIDR format of a local device

block.description: Resource allows creation and management of Equinix Network Edge BGP peering configurations

acl_template_id.description: Unique identifier of applied ACL template

additional_bandwidth.description: Additional Internet bandwidth, in Mbps, that will be allocated to the device

byol.description: Boolean value that determines device licensing mode: bring your own license or subscription (default)

core_count.description: Number of CPU cores used by device

ibx.description: Device location Equinix Business Exchange name

interface_count.description: Number of network interfaces on a device. If not specified, default number for a given device type will be used

license_file.description: Path to the license file that will be uploaded and applied on a device, applicable for some device types in BYOL licensing mode

license_file_id.description: Unique identifier of applied license file

license_token.description: License Token applicable for some device types in BYOL licensing mode

mgmt_acl_template_uuid.description: Unique identifier of applied MGMT ACL template

notifications.description: List of email addresses that will receive device status notifications

order_reference.description: Name/number used to identify device order on the invoice

purchase_order_number.description: Purchase order number associated with a device order

redundancy_type.description: Device redundancy type applicable for HA devices, either primary or secondary

redundant_id.description: Unique identifier for a redundant device, applicable for HA device

self_managed.description: Boolean value that determines device management mode: self-managed or subscription (default)

ssh_ip_address.description: IP address of SSH enabled interface on the device

ssh_ip_fqdn.description: FQDN of SSH enabled interface on the device

throughput_unit.description: Device license throughput unit (Mbps or Gbps)

vendor_configuration.description: Map of vendor specific configuration parameters for a device (controller1, activationKey, managementType, siteId, systemIpAddress)

wan_interface_id.description: device interface id picked for WAN

cluster_name.description: The name of the cluster device

num_of_nodes.description: The number of nodes in the cluster

license_file_id.description: License file id. This is necessary for Fortinet and Juniper clusters

license_token.description: License token. This is necessary for Palo Alto clusters

uuid.description: The unique id of the node

activation_key.description: Activation key. This is required for Velocloud clusters

admin_password.description: The administrative password of the device. You can use it to log in to the console. This field is not available for all device types

controller1.description: System IP Address. Mandatory for the Fortinet SDWAN cluster device

controller_fqdn.description: Controller fqdn. This is required for Velocloud clusters

hostname.description: Hostname. This is necessary for Palo Alto, Juniper, and Fortinet clusters

root_password.description: The CLI password of the device. This field is relevant only for the Velocloud SDWAN cluster

block.description: An object that has fields relevant to the vendor of the cluster device
An object that has node0 details

license_file_id.description: License file id. This is necessary for Fortinet and Juniper clusters

license_token.description: License token. This is necessary for Palo Alto clusters

uuid.description: The unique id of the node

activation_key.description: Activation key. This is required for Velocloud clusters

admin_password.description: The administrative password of the device. You can use it to log in to the console. This field is not available for all device types

controller1.description: System IP Address. Mandatory for the Fortinet SDWAN cluster device

controller_fqdn.description: Controller fqdn. This is required for Velocloud clusters

hostname.description: Hostname. This is necessary for Palo Alto, Juniper, and Fortinet clusters

root_password.description: The CLI password of the device. This field is relevant only for the Velocloud SDWAN cluster

block.description: An object that has fields relevant to the vendor of the cluster device
An object that has node1 details
An object that has the cluster details

acl_template_id.description: Unique identifier of applied ACL template

additional_bandwidth.description: Additional Internet bandwidth, in Mbps, that will be allocated to the device

ibx.description: Device location Equinix Business Exchange name

license_file.description: Path to the license file that will be uploaded and applied on a device, applicable for some device types in BYOL licensing mode

license_file_id.description: Unique identifier of applied license file

license_token.description: License Token applicable for some device types in BYOL licensing mode

mgmt_acl_template_uuid.description: Unique identifier of applied MGMT ACL template

notifications.description: List of email addresses that will receive device status notifications

redundancy_type.description: Device redundancy type applicable for HA devices, either primary or secondary

redundant_id.description: Unique identifier for a redundant device, applicable for HA device

ssh_ip_address.description: IP address of SSH enabled interface on the device

ssh_ip_fqdn.description: FQDN of SSH enabled interface on the device

vendor_configuration.description: Map of vendor specific configuration parameters for a device (controller1, activationKey, managementType, siteId, systemIpAddress)

wan_interface_id.description: device interface id picked for WAN

key_name.description: Reference by name to previously provisioned public SSH key

block.description: Definition of SSH key that will be provisioned on a device
Definition of secondary device applicable for HA setup

key_name.description: Reference by name to previously provisioned public SSH key

block.description: Definition of SSH key that will be provisioned on a device
Resource allows creation and management of Equinix Network Edge virtual devices

interface_id.description: Device network interface identifier to use for device link connection

ip_address.description: Assigned IP address from device link subnet

account_number.description: Billing account number to be used for connection charges

block.description: link
Resource allows creation and management of Equinix Network Edge device links

name.description: The name of SSH key used for identification

public_key.description: The SSH public key. If this is a file, it can be read using the file interpolation function

uuid.description: The unique identifier of the key

block.description: Resource allows creation and management of Equinix Network Edge SSH keys

device_ids.description: list of device identifiers to which user will have access

block.description: Resource allows creation and management of Equinix Network Edge SSH users

additional_info.description: One or more specifications of additional buyer information attributes that can be provided in connection definition that uses given seller profile

encapsulation.description: Seller profile's encapsulation (either Dot1q or QinQ)

metro.description: One or more specifications of metro locations supported by seller profile

redundancy_required.description: Boolean that indicate if seller requires connections to be redundant

speed_band.description: One or more specifications of speed/bandwidth supported by given seller profile

speed_customization_allowed.description: Boolean that indicates if seller allows customer to enter a custom connection speed

speed_from_api.description: Boolean that indicates if seller is deriving connection speed from an API call

uuid.description: Unique identifier of the seller profile

block.description: Use this data source to get details of Equinix Fabric layer 2	seller profile with a given name and / or organization

metro_codes.description: List of metro codes of locations that should be served by resulting profiles

name_regex.description: A regex string to apply on returned seller profile names and filter search results

profiles.description: Resulting list of profiles that match filtering criteria

speed_bands.description: List of speed bands that should be supported by resulting profiles

block.description: Use this data source to get list of Equinix Fabric layer 2 seller profiles

buyout.description: Boolean value that indicates whether the port supports unlimited connections.

encapsulation.description: The VLAN encapsulation of the port (Dot1q or QinQ)

priority.description: The priority of the device (primary / secondary) where the port resides

status.description: Port status that indicates whether a port has been assigned or is ready for connection

block.description: Use this data source to get details of Equinix Fabric port with a given name

connection_id.description: ID of the connection to lookup

facility.description: Facility which the connection is scoped to

metro.description: Metro which the connection is scoped to

organization_id.description: ID of organization to which the connection is scoped to

ports.description: List of connection ports - primary (`ports[0]`) and secondary (`ports[1]`)

project_id.description: ID of project to which the connection belongs

service_token_type.description: Only used with shared connection. Type of service token to use for the connection, a_side or z_side.

service_tokens.description: Only used with shared connection. List of service tokens required to continue the setup process with [equinix_ecx_l2_connection](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/equinix/equinix/latest/docs/resources/equinix_ecx_l2_connection) or from the [Equinix Fabric Portal](https://ecxfabric.equinix.com/dashboard)

token.description: Only used with shared connection. Fabric Token required to continue the setup process with [equinix_ecx_l2_connection](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/equinix/equinix/latest/docs/resources/equinix_ecx_l2_connection) or from the [Equinix Fabric Portal](https://ecxfabric.equinix.com/dashboard)

vlans.description: Attached vlans, only in shared connection.

access_private_ipv4.description: The ipv4 private IP assigned to the device

access_public_ipv4.description: The ipv4 management IP assigned to the device

access_public_ipv6.description: The ipv6 management IP assigned to the device

billing_cycle.description: The billing cycle of the device (monthly or hourly)

facility.description: The facility where the device is deployed

hardware_reservation_id.description: The id of hardware reservation which this device occupies

metro.description: The metro where the device is deployed

network.description: The device's private and public IP (v4 and v6) network details. When a device is run without any special network configuration, it will have 3 networks: ublic IPv4 at equinix_metal_device.name.network.0, IPv6 at equinix_metal_device.name.network.1 and private IPv4 at equinix_metal_device.name.network.2. Elastic addresses then stack by type - an assigned public IPv4 will go after the management public IPv4 (to index 1), and will then shift the indices of the IPv6 and private IPv4. Assigned private IPv4 will go after the management private IPv4 (to the end of the network list).

network_type.description: L2 network type of the device, one oflayer3, hybrid, layer2-individual, layer2-bonded

operating_system.description: The operating system running on the device

plan.description: The hardware config of the device

project_id.description: The id of the project in which the devices exists

root_password.description: Root password to the server (if still available)

ssh_key_ids.description: List of IDs of SSH keys deployed in the device, can be both user or project SSH keys

device_id.description: UUID of BGP-enabled device whose neighbors to list

code.description: The code of the Facility to match

features_required.description: Features which the facility needs to have.

plan.description: Plan which has to be available in selected location

block.description: Optional capacity specification

gateway_id.description: UUID of the Metal Gateway to fetch

ip_reservation_id.description: UUID of the IP Reservation to associate, must be in the same metro as the VLAN

private_ipv4_subnet_size.description: Size of the private IPv4 subnet to create for this gateway, one of [8 16 32 64 128]

project_id.description: UUID of the Project where the Gateway is scoped to

state.description: Status of the virtual circuit resource

vlan_id.description: UUID of the VLAN to associate

vrf_id.description: UUID of the VRF associated with the IP Reservation

device_id.description: UUID of device occupying the reservation

id.description: ID of the hardware reservation to look up

project_id.description: UUID of project this reservation is scoped to

provisionable.description: Flag indicating whether the reserved server is provisionable or not. Spare devices can't be provisioned unless they are activated first

spare.description: Flag indicating whether the Hardware Reservation is a spare. Spare Hardware Reservations are used when a Hardware Reservations requires service from Metal Equinix

switch_uuid.description: Switch short ID, can be used to determine if two devices are connected to the same switch

facility.description: Facility code filtering the IP blocks. Global IPv4 blcoks will be listed anyway. If you omit this and metro, all the block from the project will be listed

global_ipv4.description: List of CIDR expressions for Global IPv4 blocks in the project

ipv6.description: List of CIDR expressions for IPv6 blocks in the project

metro.description: Metro code filtering the IP blocks. Global IPv4 blcoks will be listed anyway. If you omit this and facility, all the block from the project will be listed

private_ipv4.description: List of CIDR expressions for Private IPv4 blocks in the project

project_id.description: ID of the project from which to list the blocks

public_ipv4.description: List of CIDR expressions for Public IPv4 blocks in the project

code.description: The code of the Metro to match

plan.description: Plan which has to be available in selected location

block.description: Optional capacity specification

name.description: Name or part of the name of the distribution. Case insensitive

organization_id.description: The UUID of the organization resource

project_ids.description: UUIDs of project resources which belong to this organization

country.description: Two letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2), e.g. US

block.description: Business' address

plans.description: Sorted list of available server plans that match the specified filters

all.description: If is set to true, the values are joined with an AND, and the requests returns only the results that match all specified values

attribute.description: The attribute used to filter. Filter attributes are case-sensitive

match_by.description: The type of comparison to apply. One of: in (default), re, substring, less_than, less_than_or_equal, greater_than, greater_than_or_equal

values.description: The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR by default, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values

block.description: One or more attribute/values pairs on which to filter results

attribute.description: The attribute used to sort the results. Sort attributes are case-sensitive

direction.description: Sort results in ascending or descending order. Strings are sorted in alphabetical order. One of: asc, desc

block.description: One or more attribute/direction pairs on which to sort results. If multiple sorts are provided, they will be applied in order

bonded.description: Flag indicating whether the port is bonded

device_id.description: Device UUID where to lookup the port

disbond_supported.description: Flag indicating whether the port can be removed from a bond

layer2.description: Flag indicating whether the port is in layer2 (or layer3) mode

name.description: Name of the port to look up, e.g. bond0, eth1

native_vlan_id.description: UUID of native VLAN of the port

network_type.description: One of layer3, hybrid, hybrid-bonded, layer2-individual, layer2-bonded

port_id.description: UUID of the port to lookup

address_family.description: 4 or 6, depending on which block you are looking for.

cidr.description: Length of CIDR prefix of the block as integer

cidr_notation.description: CIDR notation of the looked up block.

facility.description: Facility of the searched block. (for non-global blocks).

global.description: Whether to look for global block. Default is false for backward compatibility.

metro.description: Metro of the searched block (for non-global blocks).

network.description: Network IP address portion of the block specification

project_id.description: ID of the project where the searched block should be.

public.description: Whether to look for public or private block.

backend_transfer.description: Whether Backend Transfer is enabled for this project

bgp_config.description: Optional BGP settings. Refer to [Equinix Metal guide for BGP](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/local-global-bgp/)

created.description: The timestamp for when the project was created

name.description: The name which is used to look up the project

organization_id.description: The UUID of this project's parent organization

payment_method_id.description: The UUID of payment method for this project

project_id.description: The UUID by which to look up the project

updated.description: The timestamp for the last time the project was updated

user_ids.description: List of UUIDs of user accounts which belong to this project

id.description: The id of the SSH Key

name.description: The label of the Equinix Metal SSH Key

project_id.description: The Equinix Metal project id of the Equinix Metal SSH Key

public_key.description: The public SSH key that will be authorized for SSH access on Equinix Metal devices provisioned with this key

search.description: The name, fingerprint, id, or public_key of the SSH Key to search for in the Equinix Metal project

cidr.description: Length of CIDR prefix of the block as integer

cidr_notation.description: CIDR notation of the looked up block

facility.description: Facility of the block. (for non-global blocks)

gateway.description: IP address of gateway for the block

global.description: Addresses from block are attachable in all locations

id.description: ID of the block to look up

ip_address.description: Find block containing this IP address in given project

metro.description: Metro of the block (for non-global blocks)

network.description: Network IP address portion of the block specification

project_id.description: ID of the project where the searched block should be

public.description: Addresses from public block are routeable from the Internet

type.description: Address type, one of public_ipv4, public_ipv6, private_ipv4, global_ipv4, and vrf

vrf_id.description: VRF ID of the block when type=vrf

price.description: Current spot market price for given plan in given facility

device_ids.description: List of IDs of devices spawned by the referenced Spot Market Request

devices_max.description: Maximum number devices to be created

devices_min.description: Miniumum number devices to be created

end_at.description: Date and time When the spot market request will be ended.

facilities.description: Facility IDs where devices should be created

max_bid_price.description: Maximum price user is willing to pay per hour per device

metro.description: Metro where devices should be created.

project_id.description: Project ID

request_id.description: The id of the Spot Market Request

connection_id.description: UUID of Connection where the VC is scoped to

customer_ip.description: The Customer IP address which the CSR switch will peer with. Will default to the other usable IP in the subnet.

md5.description: The password that can be set for the VRF BGP peer

metal_ip.description: The Metal IP address for the SVI (Switch Virtual Interface) of the VirtualCircuit. Will default to the first usable IP in the subnet.

peer_asn.description: The BGP ASN of the peer. The same ASN may be the used across several VCs, but it cannot be the same as the local_asn of the VRF.

port_id.description: UUID of the Connection Port where the VC is scoped to

project_id.description: ID of the projct to which the virtual circuit belongs

speed.description: Description of the Virtual Circuit speed. This is for information purposes and is computed when the connection type is shared.

subnet.description:
A subnet from one of the IP blocks associated with the VRF that we will help create an IP reservation for. Can only be either a /30 or /31.
				 * For a /31 block, it will only have two IP addresses, which will be used for the metal_ip and customer_ip.
				 * For a /30 block, it will have four IP addresses, but the first and last IP addresses are not usable. We will default to the first usable IP address for the metal_ip.

tags.description: Tags attached to the virtual circuit

virtual_circuit_id.description: ID of the virtual circuit to lookup

assigned_devices_ids.description: List of device IDs to which this VLAN is assigned

facility.description: Facility where the VLAN is deployed

metro.description: Metro where the VLAN is deployed

project_id.description: ID of parent project of the VLAN. Use together with vxlan and metro or facility

vlan_id.description: Metal UUID of the VLAN resource

vxlan.description: VXLAN numner of the VLAN. Unique in a project and facility or metro. Use with project_id

ip_ranges.description: All IPv4 and IPv6 Ranges that will be available to BGP Peers. IPv4 addresses must be /8 or smaller with a minimum size of /29. IPv6 must be /56 or smaller with a minimum size of /64. Ranges must not overlap other ranges within the VRF.

local_asn.description: The 4-byte ASN set on the VRF.

name.description: User-supplied name of the VRF, unique to the project

project_id.description: Project ID

vrf_id.description: ID of the VRF to lookup

status.description: Account status for filtering. Possible values are Active, Processing, Submitted, Staged

block.description: Use this data source to get number and identifier of Equinix Network Edge billing account in a given metro location

acl_template_id.description: Unique identifier of applied ACL template

additional_bandwidth.description: Additional Internet bandwidth, in Mbps, that will be allocated to the device

byol.description: Boolean value that determines device licensing mode: bring your own license or subscription (default)

cluster_details.description: An object that has the cluster details

core_count.description: Number of CPU cores used by device

ibx.description: Device location Equinix Business Exchange name

interface_count.description: Number of network interfaces on a device. If not specified, default number for a given device type will be used

license_file.description: Path to the license file that will be uploaded and applied on a device, applicable for some device types in BYOL licensing mode

license_file_id.description: Unique identifier of applied license file

license_token.description: License Token applicable for some device types in BYOL licensing mode

mgmt_acl_template_uuid.description: Unique identifier of applied MGMT ACL template

notifications.description: List of email addresses that will receive device status notifications

order_reference.description: Name/number used to identify device order on the invoice

purchase_order_number.description: Purchase order number associated with a device order

redundancy_type.description: Device redundancy type applicable for HA devices, either primary or secondary

redundant_id.description: Unique identifier for a redundant device, applicable for HA device

secondary_device.description: Definition of secondary device applicable for HA setup

self_managed.description: Boolean value that determines device management mode: self-managed or subscription (default)

ssh_ip_address.description: IP address of SSH enabled interface on the device

ssh_ip_fqdn.description: FQDN of SSH enabled interface on the device

ssh_key.description: Definition of SSH key that will be provisioned on a device

throughput_unit.description: Device license throughput unit (Mbps or Gbps)

valid_status_list.description: Comma Separated List of states to be considered valid when searching by name

vendor_configuration.description: Map of vendor specific configuration parameters for a device (controller1, activationKey, managementType, siteId, systemIpAddress)

wan_interface_id.description: device interface id picked for WAN

block.description: Use this data source to get details of Equinix Network Edge network device with a given Name or UUID

core_count.description: Number of CPU cores used to limit platform search results

flavor.description: Device platform flavor that determines number of CPU cores and memory. Supported values: small, medium, large, xlarge

license_options.description: List of device licensing options to limit platform search result. Supported values: BYOL (Bring Your Own License), Sub (license subscription)

management_types.description: List of device management types to limit platform search results. Supported values: EQUINIX-CONFIGURED, SELF-CONFIGURED

memory.description: The amount of memory provided by device platform

memory_unit.description: Unit of memory provider by device platform

packages.description: List of software package codes to limit platform search results

block.description: Use this data source to get Equinix Network Edge device platform configuration details for a given device type

most_recent.description: Boolean value to indicate that most recent version should be used, in case when more than one result is returned

packages.description: Limits returned versions to those that are supported by given software package codes

stable.description: Boolean value to limit query results to stable versions only

version_regex.description: A regex string to apply on returned versions and filter search results

block.description: Use this data source to get Equinix Network Edge device software details for a given device type.

category.description: Device type category, one of: Router, Firewall, SDWAN

code.description: Device type short code, unique identifier of a network device type

metro_codes.description: List of metro codes where device type has to be available

vendor.description: Device type vendor i.e. Cisco, Juniper Networks, VERSA Networks

block.description: Use this data source to get Equinix Network Edge device type details
